name: Generate TCP/UDP Outbound Traffic On Multiple Ports
author: Stuart Morgan <stuart.morgan@mwrinfosecurity.com>
description:
This module generates TCP or UDP traffic across a
        sequence of ports, and is useful for finding firewall
        holes and egress filtering. It only generates traffic
        on the port range you specify. It is up to you to
        run a responder or packet capture tool on a remote
        endpoint to determine which ports are open.
platform: Linux, OSX, Unix, Solaris, BSD, Windows

options.name: WORKSPACE
options.description: Specify the workspace for this module

options.name: SESSION
options.description: The session to run this module on.

options.name: PROTOCOL
options.description: Protocol to use. (Accepted: TCP, UDP, ALL)

options.name: METHOD
options.description: The mechanism by which the packets are generated. Can be NATIVE or WINAPI (Windows only). (Accepted: NATIVE, WINAPI)

options.name: THREADS
options.description: Number of simultaneous threads/connections to try.
